title: 105_s170
content: The "Clone Pager Authorization Act of 1996" may be cited as the Act. It pertains to wire and electronic communications. The "Clone Pager Authorization Act of 1996" expands the definitions in title 18, United States Code, to include communication through a clone pager. It also prohibits the use of pen registers, trap and trace devices, or clone pagers without authorization. The "Clone Pager Authorization Act of 1996" amends section 2511(2)(h) of title 18, United States Code, to include the use of pen registers, trap and trace devices, or clone pagers with authorization. SEC. 3. AMENDMENT OF CHAPTER 206. Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code, is amended to include clone pagers in addition to trap and trace devices. Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code, is amended to include clone pagers along with trap and trace devices. The amendment involves inserting clone pagers in various sections where trap and trace devices were previously mentioned. The amendment includes adding clone pagers to sections where trap and trace devices were mentioned in Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code. The amendment adds clone pagers to sections previously mentioning trap and trace devices in Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code. The amendment adds clone pagers to sections previously mentioning trap and trace devices in Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code. In section 3123, the term "trap and trace device" is replaced with "trap and trace device, or a clone pager" in various instances. Additionally, subsection (a) is amended to authorize the installation of devices upon application under section 3122. The amendment includes adding clone pagers to sections mentioning trap and trace devices in Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code. It authorizes the installation of pen registers, trap and trace devices, or clone pagers upon application under section 3122. The amendment allows for the use of pen registers, trap and trace devices, or clone pagers in criminal investigations if certified as relevant by law enforcement. The amendment permits the installation and use of pen registers, trap and trace devices, or clone pagers in criminal investigations if deemed relevant by law enforcement. Key details include obtaining information related to an ongoing criminal investigation, such as the identity of the subscriber of the paging device for clone pagers. The amendment allows the use of pen registers, trap and trace devices, or clone pagers in criminal investigations to gather information, including the identity of the subscriber of the paging device for clone pagers. The amendment permits the use of pen registers, trap and trace devices, or clone pagers in criminal investigations to collect information, such as the subscriber's identity for clone pagers. The amendment allows the use of pen registers, trap and trace devices, or clone pagers in criminal investigations for collecting information, including the subscriber's identity for clone pagers. The amendment expands the use of pen registers, trap and trace devices, and clone pagers in criminal investigations to collect information, including the subscriber's identity for clone pagers. The amendment allows for the use of clone pagers in criminal investigations upon request by authorized law enforcement agencies. The amendment allows for the use of clone pagers in criminal investigations upon request by authorized law enforcement agencies, with Federal courts able to order providers of paging services to assist in using the clone pager unobtrusively. The amendment allows for the use of clone pagers in criminal investigations, with Federal courts able to order providers of paging services to assist in using the clone pager unobtrusively. The amendment allows Federal courts to order paging service providers to assist in using clone pagers unobtrusively in criminal investigations. The amendment allows Federal courts to order paging service providers to assist in using clone pagers unobtrusively in criminal investigations by expanding the definition of devices in various sections of the law. The amendment expands the definition of devices in various sections of the law to include clone pagers, allowing Federal courts to order paging service providers to assist in using clone pagers unobtrusively in criminal investigations. The amendment expands the definition of devices in the law to include clone pagers, allowing Federal courts to order paging service providers to assist in using clone pagers in criminal investigations. The Senate passed the amendment on November 7, 1997.
